jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.skillset: Python, Django, Flask, AWS, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, MongoDB, CI/CD
jobs.job_description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Python Developer to join our dynamic team. As a Python Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining Python code for a variety of applications. Your work will involve collaborating with other developers to create innovative software solutions, ensuring code quality, and staying updated with the latest Python developments. You will have the opportunity to implement security and data protection best practices, as well as work with front-end developers to integrate back-end systems. If you have a passion for Python and are eager to contribute to challenging projects, we would love to hear from you. Responsibilities include designing, developing, and maintaining Python code, troubleshooting and debugging code, and implementing robust security measures. Skills required include proficiency in Python, experience with web frameworks like Django or Flask, strong OOP skills, and familiarity with SQL and relational databases.

jobs.title: Senior Python Web Developer
jobs.skillset: Deep knowledge of Python 3, Experience with Vue.js or React, Experience with Django and SQLAlchemy is a plus, Experience with AWS and AWS lambda is a plus
jobs.job_description: Art+Logic is looking for Senior Python Web Developers to work with us on interesting custom software projects. We've been an all-remote company since day one—more than thirty years ago. Our ideal developers thrive in the environment of variety and challenge that is inherent to custom software development, working with us in a long-term relationship over many projects for numerous clients. The skills and needs for each project we tackle can vary widely; this goes beyond just the languages and technologies we use, and extends to the industries and problem domains we work in. We love working with developers who are excited to learn and take on new challenges. You can expect to grow in your strength and your versatility at Art+Logic and we want to help you do so. We work completely remote. We expect you to be able to work with minimal supervision and comfortably with small teams of 3-8 people. You won't have someone looking over your shoulder, so you'll need to be communicative and reliable, and hold yourself accountable. We value work/life balance, and our projects keep meetings to a minimum to ensure everyone has the flexibility to work during the times that work best for them. We are looking for contract developers able to commit between 30 and 40 hours a week most weeks, and we never expect our developers to consistently work more than 40 hours in a given week. Art+Logic is run by humans, who work and create using technology. Things can go wrong and we need to respond to the unexpected by being kind, considerate, fair, flexible, and calm. We treat our clients and peers as respectfully as we ourselves would like to be treated. This position pays between $30-$40 USD/hour.
jobs.experience_required: 5+ years of Python experience in a web development context, 5+ years of JavaScript front-end development

jobs.skillset: billing, Go, Caching, internet security protocols, CI build systems, cloud health monitoring, Block Storage, REST API design, Scaling, capacity metering, Cloud service APIs, Unix-like Operating Systems, Networking, Automated Testing, Cloud Storage, Databases, Docker, Hypervisor, Microsoft Azure, Nfs, Python, AWS, Java, Google Cloud Platform, Smb, Load Balancers, Linux, Kubernetes
jobs.job_description: In this role you will be developing a Cloud Orchestrator and help accelerate the leadership of NetApp in Hybrid Cloud globally. We expect you to be an excellent coder who will take a lead in design and implementation as per the requirements of a managed Cloud Services, and should be able to quickly learn the existing code & architecture. Proficient with Go or C++ or C#. Experience with Python, Java/C-sharp is added advantage. Hands-on Expertise in Container based technologies preferably Kubernetes & Dockers. Thorough understanding and extensive experience with building orchestration on at least one of the major hyper-scaler cloud providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform). Experienced with Cloud service APIs (e.g. AWS, Azure or GCP). Experience working in SMB, NFS & internet security protocols. Expertise in REST API design and implementation. Thorough understanding of Linux or other Unix-like Operating Systems. Should own the deliverables from end-end, design, implement, test automation to ensure high quality deliverable. Experience of CI build systems or automated testing. Understands the design, architecture principles and best practices in Cloud along with cloud health monitoring, capacity metering, billing. Highly knowledgeable in infrastructure like hypervisor, Cloud Storage and experience with cloud services including Databases, Caching, Object and Block Storage, Scaling, Load Balancers, Networking etc.

jobs.job_description: We are seeking a highly skilled AWS Developer with expertise in Python and SQL to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and deploying cloud-based applications, managing data pipelines, and leveraging AWS services to ensure optimal performance and scalability. Requirements & Skills: Must have 3-4 years of Python developer experience, AWS: Strong experience with core AWS services (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, Cloud Formation, etc.), Python: Proficiency in Python programming for cloud applications, automation, and data processing, SQL: Advanced skills in writing optimized SQL queries and working with relational databases (RDS, MySQL, PostgreSQL), Data Processing: Familiarity with tools like AWS Glue, Pandas, and ETL frameworks, Version Control: Experience with Git and version control best practices. Additional Skills: Experience with serverless architectures (AWS Lambda, API Gateway), Knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker, ECS, EKS) is a plus, Familiarity with Big Data tools like AWS Redshift, S3, and data lakes, Strong problem-solving and debugging skills, Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Preferred Qualifications: AWS Certification (e.g., AWS Certified Developer Associate), Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence tools is a plus, Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.

jobs.job_description: We are recruiting for our esteemed client - Telamon HR Solutions. This position offers a fully remote working environment. We are on the lookout for experienced Senior Python Developers to join our team in the realm of AI technology. This role is perfect for professionals passionate about crafting cutting-edge solutions and eager to lead in AI innovations. Essential Skills: Develop robust Python code to address challenging problems. Leverage analytical skills and business acumen to extract insights from public databases. Articulate the reasoning and methodology behind coding in Jupyter notebooks or alternative formats. Comprehensive experience in Python development. Strong command of the language's syntax and best practices. Prior experience in solving algorithmic challenges. Experience in Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Skills Required for TWA: The ideal candidates should be able to clearly articulate their problem-solving approaches. Create practical coding solutions. Design test cases to confirm their solutions. Debug and optimize their code for performance. Qualifications: A minimum of 3 years in software development with a proven track record in back-end implementation. Comprehensive experience in crafting scalable and resilient cloud-native applications. Mastery of Python programming. At least 2 years of experience in Technical Writing. Experience in API development. Familiarity with JSON. Knowledge of AWS/Azure/GCP environments is favorable. Strong foundational understanding of software development principles, architecture, algorithms, and problem-solving. Superior communication skills, strong organizational abilities, and meticulous attention to detail.

jobs.title: Principal Python Engineer
jobs.skillset: Data learning, Architecture Design, Design, S3, CSS, Json, HTML, Database Design, Scrum, Ruby, Web Scraping, Python, AWS
jobs.job_description: Spreetail propels brands to increase their ecommerce market share across the globe while improving their operational costs. Learn how we are building one of the fastest-growing ecommerce companies in history: www.spreetail.com . At Spreetail, our Software & Technology teams build scalable, reliable, and cutting-edge software to propel Spreetail to being a top ecommerce company. We are seeking an engineering professional who is diverse in custom software development, has strong architecture experience, and is passionate about leading teams. If you are looking for an environment that provides creative freedom, work-life balance, and meaningful relationships, keep scrolling down. This position is remote. This position will be remote in the country of India. How You Will Achieve Success - Responsible for building empowered teams with the passion and engagement to drive towards business outcomes and act as a servant leader to ensure engineers have the insights, tools, and support to execute effectively. - We are a fully remote department, as an engineering manager you are responsible for ensuring the team is engaged and present while at work. - Visualize teams out of the office to ensure organization transparency and ownership of LTR metrics and ensure engineers understand the expectations as well as the why behind them. Ceremony facilitation ownership for demos, daily standups, and retros. - Accountability for team ownership of operational surface area, team alerting, and root-cause analysis. Embody the Science &Technology Principles and use them to guide decisions. Responsible for performance management of your team and supporting their career development. - You create an environment of knowledge sharing and growth, placing a high priority on leading and developing others through coaching, feedback, and stretch opportunities. What Experiences Will Help You In This Role - 10+ years experience in an engineering or product role, building solutions from the ground up that support major business functions. Deep understanding of Agile and Lean principles and measures. Experience being immersed in engineering, product, and design functions, understanding the various processes. - Negotiation skills necessary for the management of external vendors, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to inspire colleagues. - Feedback and Mentoring: Mentors Software Engineer IIs to support growth. Provides Manager Feedback to Improve team - Technical Debt Management: Understands areas of technical debt in systems and infrastructure. Quality Standards: Responsible for establishing and maintaining quality standards. Interviewing: Leads and participates in technical interviews. - Planning and Change Management: Contributes to planning and change management activities involving technical infrastructure and process improvements. - Experience in Python Data learning Design, Web Scraping, AWS S3 and Blue Database Design, Architecture Design, and has experience being a good principal engineering mentor. - Hands-on experience with Python or Ruby, R, AWS Database Design, JSON, HTML & CSS, Web Scrape Design, and Scrum process. This is a remote position and requires candidates to have an available work-from-home setup. Desktop/Laptop System Requirements - 4th generation or higher, at least Intel i3 or equivalent processor; - at least 4GB RAM; - Windows 10 and above or MAC OSX operating system - You are required to provide your own dual monitors A strong and stable internet connection (A DSL, cable or fiber wired internet service with 10 Mbps plan or higher for primary connection) PC Headset A high-definition (HD) external or integrated webcam with at least 720p resolution.
